5.31.24  7:01 pm   just wanted to say thanks for making such a big deal about putting dates on everything.  i started doing it like 6 years ago now (i think because of something you wrote here) and i finally feel like i have a solid base to work from creatively rather than a huge unorganized mess.  like the ability to "merge" stuff from two different places together and preserve the date order really puts things in context in a way that often surprises me

      'time' turns out to be a very loyal friend

5.31.24  6:24 pm   Is it necessary to struggle when making something creative?

      no

      you already did

      pretty soon

5.31.24  1:04 pm   if you dehydrate a watermelon until there's no water left is it still a watermelon ???? or is it :( just a melon :(

5.31.24  11:22 am   I've seen the pages that are blue and red which are compilations of the same question, but I just found a new one that's blue and green which seems to be a compilation of questions with the same subject and I feel as though I have made an excellent discovery. How do I deal with this?

      maybe one day you can get a chance to provide the same thrill to someone else

5.31.24  11:07 am   i relate to your want to learn languages but not prioritizing it over other things in general. does this cause a frustrated stirring in your soul like it does me or some other feeling? how do u deal with wanting to learn something new but there's too much other important shit going on 

      i'm not sure. i got the ....... 2020 virus in 2023 for a little while and was much much too uncomfortable to do almost anything. but for some reason i was in the mood to start chipping away at really learning a second language. that somehow jumpstarted my progress, and also made me realize how chill and easy language learning actually is, even while it takes a long time, it's quite rewarding at every stage

5.31.24  10:09 am   hey bill i have a question about writing songs. your music inspired me to write songs that don't stay in the same key the whole way through. i later realized this happens all the time in some of the most popular songs. anyways i've learned to not care so much about 'key' when i think of melodies and stuff and just try to think of what sounds good. the only problem is sometimes it's not clear to me if i like a part because it includes a strange change i've never heard before or because it actually sounds good. i'm essentially asking how to differentiate "cool scale bro" from "wow this song is good". i'm asking you because your music includes many complicated changes but still speaks to me on a spiritual level.

      just, what would actually really blow your mind. can you answer this honestly

5.31.24  10:02 am   What is your favourite movie?

      none of them are good enough, but on second thought, all of them are good enough

5.31.24  9:48 am   How do you start writing a song. 

      you can start it in a lot of different ways -- which actually means, the most important thing is that you do not have to work on the rest of it at that same time. instead, start a bunch of songs, in a bunch of different ways, in one session. remove the pressure of having to switch jobs entirely (from song starter to song finisher), and you'll get a chance to really try a whole bunch of different start-methods and start-tricks -- even try each one of them like 10 times. just make a whole pile. if even just 30% of them are good, that's gonna be a LOT of starting seeds, which your songwriting/songworking depertment will be very very pleased about later. and don't forget to log the ones that come to you by accident when you weren't even trying to do it. feeds the songworking department just the same. again, remember that you are not supposed to drop everything and go to work in the song-working department as soon as you accidentally get a good songseed start, in the middle of your trainride or whatever else. the system is working great if you just log it and continue your life. the songworking department will receive these seeds in due turn, just the same. anyway, that's how i do it

5.31.24  7:41 am   I'm not an octopus

      i see what you mean

5.31.24  4:07 am   Do you like doodling in a notebook?

      that sounds lovely

5.31.24  3:48 am   are you always making music/writing songs, or does it come in bursts? I struggle with regularly making stuff. I hyperfocus for weeks on something, finish it - then take months to get back into that state again. I get rusty, and have to re-learn a lot of things.

I guess what I'm asking is, do you have any tips for just making music? 

      i think you are doing ok

      that's one of the big 3, of science

5.30.24  11:53 pm   what do i do about extremely confusing math when everyone else finds it really easy?

      first don't think about everyone else, and then once you've cleared that from your mind, actually just ask what the math is. like, which math is this that you're doing and why have you found yourself in a situation where you must do it. For example, let's say it's kitchen math. (??) what you'd wanna do there is backtrack and think about the kitchen itself. i can't use a better example because you didn't tell me which math you have or what it's about

5.30.24  11:50 pm   everybody vibes sometimes, but do you ever deliberately make the choice to just be vibing

      yes, but let's be fair, that's never been the only name for such a state

5.30.24  11:50 pm   why do people say "im sorry" when you explain something bad that happened to you if they didn't do anything to be sorry for?

      or, on the other hand, why do people claim to have sorrow when what they actually have is guilt

      the problem here is that is you are already in the bathroom

      something you didn't expect to be special about them before

5.30.24  6:48 pm   How do you go about recording vocals and crisp harmonies? Have you just TRAINED your voice to always be on pitch so it doesn't sound muffled? Do you ever fine-tune it somehow? You know what I mean, right? I usually either don't hear myself or i don't hear the track while recording, and it's been tedious. Makes all my harmonies sound like parallel moving tritones. Also how do you personally write vocal harmonies? Do you just have them in your head and instantly record all parts on top of each other? This is a cry for help.

      you asked me about recording, you asked me about writing, and you asked me about singing, between the lines you asked me also about arranging, and you also asked me about editing. and you also asked about mixing. all specifically in the context of background vocals. to answer this properly would require some kind of lengthy mentorship

5.30.24  6:24 pm   What is a good problem to have?

      having all or none of the problems

5.30.24  5:58 pm   Do you like floating along?

      from time to time

5.30.24  5:39 pm   i recorded a song idea years ago. Today i checked it out and thought "oh that's boring i'll never want to make it" did this happen to you before? i made a note with that thought in the folder but i'll probably just delete if i still feel this way years later

      there are always some ideas that may feel boring sometimes. but almost any idea can be made good. so one of the many writing methods i sometimes use, is to select random entries and work them. quite often that lifts them to much higher status

5.30.24  4:55 pm   Do you think all people are born good by default?

      even better

5.30.24  4:50 pm   will there one day be no trees

      yes, but then at some point after that there may be trees again

5.30.24  3:07 pm   What is causation?

      when one thing causes another thing. in other words, it's when that second thing happens as a result of the first thing

5.30.24  3:04 pm   when do you sleep? my friend noticed that based on the times when you answer questions, it doesn't look like there's an obvious gap where you'd be asleep lol

      yes, but the problem with this logic is that the date/time is not when i answered it, it's when you asked it. that's one of the most convenient parts of this site: you can ask questions while i'm asleep
